question: What is an investment-linked policy?

options.B: A capital and returns guaranteed policy
options.D: A plan that offers clients’ coverage and investment returns

question: All the following statements are TRUE EXCEPT:

options.A: The investment-linked policy is directly linked to investment performance
options.B: Once the policy is in-force, the clients’ investments will grow steadily
options.C: Fund managers will make sure that the investment-linked policy is shielded from market fluctuations
options.D: The investment-linked policy only provides coverage and nothing else

question: Investment-linked Insurance policy is named as the following around the world EXCEPT:
“... is designed to shift the uncertainties of investment gains or losses to the policy holders...” The excerpt describes what of the following accurately?

options.A: Policyholders who choose to take investment-linked policies must realize that they are also responsible to monitor the performance of their policy to ensure a reasonable return
options.B: The chances that the policy values going to zero is impossible because the Fund Managers, companies and agents will ensure that the policy is profitable at all times
options.C: Insurance companies, fund managers will wash their hands off the policy once the policy is taken and leave it solely to the agents and policy holders to monitor it
options.D: Agents are responsible to the clients’ only and must ensure that they monitor the policy at all times

question:
An investment-linked plan has the following features:
I. Provide cover for death and total permanent disability.
II. Participate in investments managed by the insurer.
III. Can provide a good return if monitored well.
IV. Largely depends on the clients’ ability to be good at investing in equities market.
An agent owes the client a moral obligation to

options.A: Educate a client to be an expert investor
options.B: To recommend specific funds to invest in
options.C: Educate clients’ with some basic and sound investment principles
options.D: Make decisions on behalf of the client

question:
What considerations must be taken before making an investment decision?
I. Investment objectives, Availability of Funds, Diversification.
II. Risk or Security, Promised Money, Tax issues.
III. Investment Horizon, Performance of Investment, Accessibility of Funds.
IV. Economic Reports, Insurance Companies Asset base, Government Regulations.

Clients want to invest:
I. To lead a comfortable lifestyle
II. To be comfortable during retirement
III. To amass great wealth
IV. To provide adequate funding for their children’s needs
What must an agent do to ensure the client is given proper advice on investment?

options.A: Ensure that there is a right combination of objectives and make sure proper risk analysis is done
options.B: Show the wide selection of investment for the client to choose from
options.C: Motivate the client to borrow money to invest in guaranteed investment vehicles
options.D: Ensure that the advice is advantageous to the agent and the insurance company

question:
Why is diversification in investment recommended?
I. So as not to be exposed in one particular class of investments
II. To even out market fluctuations and not suffer too much losses
III. To ensure the investments will always do well
IV. To ensure that they can realize their financial objectives faster
The following instruments fall under corporate bonds EXCEPT:
What is the disadvantage of investing in unit trusts?

options.A: Unit trusts have lower risk compared to shares
options.B: They are managed by professional investment teams
options.C: Extra costs and charges are included in this vehicle

question: Sukuk bonds have the following characteristics EXCEPT:

options.A: They are issued by pooled funds
options.B: They adhere to strict Syariah principles
options.C: They can be guaranteed or not by their originators
options.D: They can only be bought by Banks and Financial Institutions

question:
Mr. Indran wants to invest his money in a conservative steady income generating investment vehicles. Your suggestion to him would be to put his money in:
I. Treasury Bills, Sukuk Bonds, REITs
II. Preference Shares, Warrants, Derivatives
III. Fixed Income Securities, Government Bonds, Corporate Bonds
IV. Commodities, Futures, REITs

Adam lives in the UK. He was impressed by the investment-linked life insurance policy that you have bought in Malaysia. He is now back to London and wants to buy a similar plan. What plan should he buy from his agent?
The takaful investment-linked life insurance plan was developed due to…

options.A: Meeting the market demands and financial demands
options.B: The response to the religious principles and practices of the Muslims
options.C: The fact that there were no products suitable for Muslims in Malaysia before this
options.D: Tap into a vast and very lucrative insurance market

question: All the following statements are false EXCEPT:

options.A: Takaful Insurance plans can only be sold by Islamic insurance companies
options.B: All insurance companies can develop and sell Takaful products as they wish
options.C: Takaful insurance products must adhere to the Syariah law requirements
options.D: Takaful insurance can only be sold to and purchased by Muslims in Malaysia

question: During a market crash, which fund suffers the biggest fall?

options.A: Funds that mainly invest in cash instruments like fixed deposits, treasury bills, government bonds
options.B: Funds that invest in overseas properties, REITs and growth stocks
options.C: Funds that invest in fixed income funds, balanced funds and Sukuk Bonds
options.D: Funds that invest in equities market both locally and overseas

question: Funds that basically invest in government, corporate and fixed income instruments seeking income producing characteristics are known as:
Switching of funds happen in unit trust and investment-linked products. Switching is advantageous because…

options.A: It allows the smoothening process of uncertain market conditions
options.B: It allows the clients to make huge profits whence switches are done
options.C: It is a method to safeguard your principal invested
options.D: It is good because the client does not incur any charges related to constant switches

question:
Rahim is a very cautious investor. He wants steady income and to safe-guard his principal amount invested. Where would you suggest he puts his money?
I. Government, Corporate and Sukuk Bonds
II. Fixed income instruments
III. Cash funds
IV. Specialized funds

Chee Seng wants to have a specific amount of money in 10 years. He is not averse to risk. He wants your suggestion. Where can he put his money?
I. In a unit trust and investment-linked product that is heavy into equities
II. In a fund that specifically targets on high growth
III. In a fund that is mainly invested in government securities
IV. In a bank deposit and cash fund
Which of the following statement is FALSE?

options.A: Bond funds can be found in the private sector
options.B: Bond funds can be found in the public sector
options.C: Bond funds are also called “fixed income funds”

question:
Generally people will choose between investing in assets that generate:
I. Regular income
II. Irregular income
III. Unpredictable gains or income
IV. Capital gains
Top-ups are allowed in investment-linked policies. What happens to the total premium paid under the top-up?

options.A: The company converts the total top-up premium and accumulates it into the existing account
options.B: The company opens a new account and deposits the converted top-up units into this account
options.C: The company deposits the top-up premium into the existing account and levies all charges as per the original policy
options.D: The company will use the top-up premium minus the top-up charges and deposit the units into the policy owner’s account

question:
A company can use the following methods in an investment-linked policies death claim payout:
I. Upon a Death claim being submitted, the company will pay only the claim based on the total unit accumulation multiplied by the unit price
II. Upon a Death claim being submitted, the company will pay the face amount of the initial death coverage irrespective of unit accumulations
III. Upon a Death claim being submitted, the company will pay the unit value plus the sum assured
IV. Upon a death claim being submitted, the company will pay only the unit value plus the sum assured and any top-up amounts separately
In a regular premium investment-linked policy, the policy holder can do the following EXCEPT:

options.A: Have a premium holiday if there are sufficient funds in the policy
options.B: Increase or decrease his sum assured according to his present needs
options.C: Increase his premium payments with regular premium top-ups and single top-ups
options.D: Have his cover cancelled and only ensure his premiums are used for investments

question:
The benefits of an investment-linked policy are as follows:
I. The ability of the company to pool and diversify
II. The flexibility it offers
III. The minimal charges levied on the policy
IV. The insulation of market risks by the company for the client

The flexibility offered by the investment-linked policy includes the following:
I. Policy owner can ascertain the level of premium that needs to be paid.
II. Policy owner can decide to add single or multiple top-ups.
III. Policy owner is subjected to a definite amount of premium payment that is non-negotiable.
IV. Company will not charge any fees for premium holidays taken.

The disadvantages found in an investment-linked policy are:
I. It is subjected to the smoothening process of the company
II. It is subjected to no charges if the company does not make any investment returns
III. It is subjected to fixed charges specified in the policy document
IV. It is subjected to the vagaries of the stock market

Cash values that use investment vehicles are not immune to risk. This means that the value of the cash value account can increase and decrease depending on the performance of the market. Individuals who use earnings from the cash value account may need to pay more out-of-pocket from premium payments when investments are performing poorly. Individuals are also not permitted to withdraw funds from the cash value while the policy is in force. What can be learned from the passage above?

options.A: Clients investing in an investment-linked product are at a disadvantage and should choose to put their money in traditional whole life with profit plans
options.B: Clients must accept the fact that by buying an investment-linked policy they are also responsible to accept the changes that can take place in the stock market
options.C: Clients must put the total burden and blame on the fund managers who are responsible in making only positive returns
options.D: Clients can treat the investment-link policy as their personal bank account and do as they wish

question:
The apparent advantages of an investment-linked Insurance policy are:
I. The flexibility it offers in terms of choosing the premium payment amount, the sum assured and top-ups
II. The ability to design the policy to meet one’s life goals as you go along the policy term
III. The guaranteed cash value accumulation that happens
IV. The definite understanding that all investment-linked policies are guaranteed by the company and Bank Negara
Marcus argues that a person should buy a short-term life insurance policy and invest the rest on other investment vehicles. Do you agree with him?

options.A: Yes. It is wise for a person to do so as they are quite proficient in the workings of the investment markets.
options.B: No. It would be disastrous as the person will not be able to handle the portfolio as it is a very difficult thing to do alone.
options.C: No. The short-term life insurance policy will not be able to cover his liabilities over a long period of time as we do not know what will happen to us then.
options.D: Yes. This is an intelligent way of doing personal financial planning and it is being practiced by all successful people.

question:
You have just finished an interview with a client. He is a young married man with a 2 years’ old child. He wants to purchase insurance for his child. What would be a good combination that you would suggest?
I. A Term Life policy for protection on Death and TPD
II. A Comprehensive Medical Card
III. A Dread Disease Policy
IV. An 18 years endowment plan
V. An investment-linked policy.

What are the criteria used to compare traditional life insurance and investment-linked policies?
I. Investment returns and Risks
II. Premium Computation
III. Death Benefit
IV. Surrender Value

Salim and Siti are two self-employed people. They do not contribute to EPF and have two young children. They would like to maximize their tax relief from insurance. What is the maximum relief that they can claim?

The report to policy owners on the performance of the investment-linked fund must include the following information:
I. A summary of the audited financial statement of the fund
II. Trend analysis of not less than five (5) years, where available, on the net investment return of the fund
III. Composition and list of investments held by the fund as of reporting date
IV. Any charges levied against the fund during the year
All sales materials and policy forms for investment-linked life insurance policies must contain the following information:

options.A: Policy benefits will be based on the performance of the funds and the factors affecting the policy benefits. Wherever possible, provide hypothetical illustrations to guide policy owners on the policy benefits
options.B: The number and value of units held at the end of the previous statement period
options.C: Charges e.g. initial charge, management fee, mortality and riders costs, etc. incurred during the statement period
options.D: Any other information that BNM may from time to time deem necessary

question: What is the use of the Customer Fact Find (CFF) Form?

options.A: To submit a comprehensive picture to the company
options.B: To allow the agent to build up a clear understanding of the customer’s circumstances
options.C: To make sure that the clients’ information is used to design future and more effective policies
options.D: To only comply to Bank Negara Malaysia’s new requirements

question:
The CFF form will address the following areas:
I. Customer’s Personal and Dependents Details
II. Life and Financial Priorities and Goals
III. Risk Return Ratio
IV. Financial Needs Analysis
Indran is a very satisfied with his agent as he has done a lot for him. He will probably do the following EXCEPT:

options.A: Recommend that his agent be given a letter of commendation and an award from the company
options.B: Speak highly about the level of commitment and service given to him by his agent
options.C: Keep his agent as a very well-guarded secret
options.D: Help him in prospecting and referring his friends to the agent

question:
An agent can potentially get prospects effectively by utilizing the following methods:
I. Approaching his natural market
II. Taking out advertisement in newspapers and magazines to promote himself
III. Asking for qualified referrals from his satisfied clients
IV. Obtain a list of existing clients from a rival company to replace their plans with his company’s ones

A truly professional person makes the following commitments:
I. Proudly announce about the quality of his clients and drop names to impress others
II. Shares intimate knowledge of his clients to fellow agents
III. Maintain a very high ethical standard when it comes to any information pertaining his clients
IV. Conduct himself in a professional and honorable way whilst carrying out his work

The Code of Ethics and Conduct for agents dwells on:
I. To avoid conflict of interest
II. Avoid misuse of position
III. To prevent misuse of information
IV. To ensure completeness and accuracy of relevant records
V. To ensure confidentiality of communication and transactions between the life insurance company and its policy owners and clients
VI. To ensure fair and equitable treatment of all policy owners and others who rely on or who are associated with the life insurance company
VII. To conduct business with utmost good faith and integrity

options.A: The seven principle underlying the guidelines
options.B: Bank Negara’s guidelines on good agent governance
options.C: The international standards set for agents
options.D: The leading criteria for the awarding of LIAM’s national award

question:
Sebastian is very unhappy with the insurance policy that he has bought. To whom can he complain?
I. Bank Negara’s Insurance Mediation Bureau
II. LIAM
III. The particular insurance company
IV. The Newspaper
What is the main reason for the steady growth of the Insurance Industry in Malaysia?

options.A: The liberalization of regulations by the Ministry of Finance and Bank Negara Malaysia
options.C: The efforts by insurance companies to design and offer customer-centric and good plans
options.D: The robust growth of the country’s economy

question:
Why do you think people are not investing nowadays?
I. The adverse economic conditions, in the last 15 years, have made them be wary of investments
II. The fall of many established financial institutions in the last few years
III. The stock market cannot be approached by ordinary people
IV. Many investors have seen their fortunes dwindling, due to the financial crisis
All the following statements are TRUE EXCEPT:

options.A: Cash can be regarded as an investment
options.B: The capital value of cash will not increase and will not generate any additional income by itself
options.C: Cash deposits are liquid instruments that carry little or no risk when the principal amounts invested can be lost
options.D: Cash instruments can include Treasury Bills and Bank Accounts

question:
Rank the following funds in an ascending order in terms of risk?
I. Equity funds
II. Derivatives and Futures fund
III. Government Bond fund
IV. Cash fund
V. Balanced fund
The following benefits of investing in an investment-linked policy is FALSE EXCEPT:

options.A: Client is expected to monitor and switch the funds on his own all the time the policy is in force
options.B: The burden of fund management is borne by the company’s professional management team and does not burden the client
options.C: Client has the option to instruct the fund managers to follow his investment outlook and strategies
options.D: Client has the option to make decisions on how the company must invest his money totally

question: The Government has allowed insurance premiums paid as tax relief because:

options.A: The Government feels that by giving this relief, all Malaysians will be able to purchase insurance easily
options.B: The Government is giving this relief to encourage national thrift and promote individual financial independence
options.C: The Government feels that the tax that they will collect if the relief is not given is considerably low and insignificant
options.D: The Government is allowing this relief to make sure it is popular

question: Why is it important to identify and establish customer’s needs?

options.A: To project an air of professionalism to the client
options.B: To ensure that the client is comfortable and knows the important areas concerning the policy that he is going to buy
options.C: To ensure that the agent will get good referrals
options.D: To ensure that the agent gets to sell the policy as fast as possible

question: Which of the following investments carries the highest risk and uncertainty?

options.A: Investment that offers the lowest opportunities for capital growth
options.B: Investment that offers the lowest opportunities for income growth
options.C: Investment that offers the greatest opportunities for capital growth
options.D: Investment that offers the acceptable opportunities for income growth

question: What is diversification?

options.A: The process of investing in the same asset classes and across different market environments
options.B: The process of investing across different asset classes and across different market environments
options.C: The process of investing in the same asset classes and not across different market environments
options.D: The process of investing across different asset classes and not across different market environment

question: What is debenture stock?

options.A: Secured loan to a company in which the security is either a fixed charge on company's property or some of its assets
options.B: Unsecured loan to a company in which the security is either a fixed charge on company's property or some of its assets
options.C: Secured loan to a company in which the security is either a fixed charge on company's well-being or capital
options.D: Unsecured loan to a company in which the security is either a fixed charge on company's well-being or capital

question:
Treasury bills are ___________.
I. Issued by the BNM (Central Bank)
II. Is the safest type of instrument
III. These are short-term financial instruments
IV. The repayment period is normally more than one year

In a regular premium investment-linked whole life insurance plan, __________.
I. Premium top-ups and holidays, subject to the life office’s administrative rules, are usually allowed
II. Life protection is the main objective of the plan with investment as a nominal purpose
III. A “one-off” premium contribution is made to the policy which uses the premium to purchase units in an investment-linked fund and to provide certain level life cover
IV. Withdrawals and surrenders, usually after the payment of a few years premium, are allowed

The charges for the investment-linked life insurance are likely to be a combination of two or more of the following:
I. Annual fund management fee
II. Mortality charges
III. Surrender charges
IV. Policy fee
These funds are normally segmented based on geographical regions or particular industries. These are:

The consumer buying decision process includes the following stages in order?
I. Sales interview
II. Information search
III. Post-purchase evaluation
IV. Problem recognition
